newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Citatah active on private placement talk.
newsitem.headline: Citatah active on private placement talk.

text.p: Shares of Indonesian marble producer PT Citatah were actively traded on Thursday due to intense market talk of a possible private placement and rights issue, brokers said.
"Previously, there had been rumours of a possible private placement but then I also heard today that they might propose a rights issue," a broker with London-based securities house said.
The company officials were not available immediately for comment.
Local-led investors were seen actively buying on the counter which also boosted by the expectation of better-than-expected 1996 net profit, brokers said.
In early afternoon session, Citatah rose 200 rupiah to 2,775 with some 8.5 million shares changing hands, after earlier rose 10.68 percent to 2,850 rupiah.

Previously Citatah director Taufik Johannes was quoted by Bisnis Indonesia daily on Tuesday as saying that its 1996 net profit was 25 billion rupiah and it had revised up a net profit target for 1997 at 33 billion rupiah.
The market consensus of Citatah's net profit in 1996 was 24 billion rupiah and 33.7 billion rupiah for 1997.
